fr.upmc.colins.farm3.dispatcher

Class RequestDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.upmc.colins.farm3.dispatcher.RequestDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.ComponentI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicRequestDispatcher

    public class RequestDispatcher
extends fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
    The class RequestDispatcher implements a request dispatcher

    Description

    A request dispatcher is a component that will forward received requests to its dedicated virtual machine. The request dispatcher choose the least recently used virtual machine when forwarding request.

    Created on : jan. 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Colins-Alasca

                 java.lang.String inboundPortURI,

                 java.lang.Double meanNrofInstructions,
                 java.lang.Double standardDeviation,
                 java.lang.String actuatorResponseArrivalInboundPortUri)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        create a request dispatcher

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the request dispatcher
        inboundPortURI - URI of the port used to received requests, linked to a request generator
        outboundPortURIs - URI of the ports used to send requests, linked to the virtual machines
        vmRequestArrivalInboundPortUris - URI of the ports to each virtual machines
        meanNrofInstructions - the mean number of instructions
        standardDeviation - the standard deviation
        rdResponseGeneratorOutboundPortUri -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • endServicingEvent

        public void endServicingEvent()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        process a end servicing event, e.g. update the statistics for the average service time, and then if the queue is not empty execute a begin servicing event immediately.

        Contract
